discussion.content:
The DNS record used to look up the IP address assigned to a domain name is:

A. A (Address) record.

The A record maps a domain name to an IPv4 address. When a user enters a domain name into a web browser or other network application, the A record is queried to determine the corresponding IPv4 address of the server hosting that domain.

questions.question_text: Which of the following DNS records is used to look up the IP address assigned to a domain name?

choices.D: Substitute hard tokens in place of soft tokens.
choices.C: Remove two-factor authentication from the users’ accounts.
choices.B: Implement allow listing and add the office IP address as an exception.
choices.A: Leave the current rules in place and disable Wi-Fi on all devices.

questions.question_text: A company recently enabled two-factor authentication in order to enhance security. Users should be prompted for two-factor authentication when working outside of the office, but are also being prompted when connecting to the office Wi-Fi. Which of the following should the technician do?

discussion.content:
B. Implement allow listing and add the office IP address as an exception.

Allow listing (also known as whitelisting) involves specifying trusted IP addresses or ranges from which users can access resources without being prompted for two-factor authentication. By adding the office IP address as an exception to the two-factor authentication requirement, users connecting to the office Wi-Fi will not be prompted for two-factor authentication, while users working outside of the office will still be required to authenticate.

B
Allow listing is a security technique that allows only specific IP addresses or domains to access a network or a service. By adding the office IP address as an exception, the company can prevent two-factor authentication from being triggered when users are connected to the office Wi-Fi, since the office network is considered trusted. This way, users will only be prompted for two-factor authentication when working outside of the office, which enhances security.
I say the answer is D

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an aspect of using client-side virtualization?

discussion.content:
An aspect of using client-side virtualization is:

B. Legacy software support.

Client-side virtualization allows users to run multiple virtual machines (VMs) on their local computer, enabling them to run different operating systems and software simultaneously. This capability is particularly useful for supporting legacy software that may require older operating systems or dependencies that are no longer compatible with the host system. By running legacy software in a virtual machine, users can maintain compatibility and access applications that would otherwise be incompatible with their current operating environment.

Therefore, the correct answer is:

C
A load balancer is a device or software that distributes network or application traffic across a group of servers, often referred to as a "server farm." This helps in ensuring that no single server becomes overloaded and that the workload is balanced efficiently across all available resources.

Selected Answer: C
C. Load balancer

questions.question_text: Which of the following controls the flow of users connecting to web server farms and prevents overutilization on any individual server?

discussion.content:
The most likely reason is A. Missing Wi-Fi adapter.
A Wi-Fi adapter is a device that allows a computer to connect to a wireless network. A legacy workstation may not have a built-in Wi-Fi adapter, or it may have an outdated or incompatible one. If the workstation does not have a Wi-Fi adapter, it will not be able to detect or access any wireless networks, regardless of the location, signal strength, or configuration of the network.
To fix this issue, the technician can install a Wi-Fi adapter on the workstation, either internally or externally. An internal Wi-Fi adapter is a card that fits into a slot on the motherboard, while an external Wi-Fi adapter is a device that plugs into a USB port. The technician should choose a Wi-Fi adapter that is compatible with the workstation’s operating system, hardware, and wireless standards .

A. Missing Wi-Fi adapter is the most likely reason.

If the workstation was previously connected to a wired network and didn't require a Wi-Fi adapter, it's possible that the new location doesn't have one installed.

GG

A. Missing Wi-Fi adapter

A legacy workstation may not have a built-in Wi-Fi adapter, which would prevent it from connecting to a wireless network.

Selected Answer: A
A. Missing Wi-Fi adapter

questions.question_text: After moving a user's legacy workstation into a new private office that does not have a LAN connection, the technician is unable to connect to a wireless network. Which of the following is the most likely reason?
